com.kulana.core.foundation.webdriver

Class DriverHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kulana.core.foundation.webdriver.DriverHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTest, AbstractUIObject, PerformanceTest

    public class DriverHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper above standard Selenium WebDriver, implements additional complex methods for stable interaction with UI. Also it implements logging and screenshot capturing and crypto logic.
    Author:
    Alex Khursevich

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DriverHelper() 
      DriverHelper(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)

    • Method Detail

      • isElementPresent

        public boolean isElementPresent(ExtendedWebElement element)
        Checks page HTML DOM model for element presence. It waits for element max time = 'explicit_timeout' seconds, retrying to find every 'retry_timeout' seconds.
        Parameters:
        element - ExtendedWebElement to find
        Returns:
        is element found on UI

      • isElementPresent

        public boolean isElementPresent(java.lang.String eName,
                       org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
        Checks page HTML DOM model for element presence. It waits for element max time = 'explicit_timeout' seconds, retrying to find every 'retry_timeout' seconds.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to find
        eName - element name for better logging
        Returns:
        is element found on UI

      • isElementPresent

        public boolean isElementPresent(ExtendedWebElement element,
                       long timeout)
        Checks page HTML DOM model for element presence. It waits for element max time = 'maxWait' seconds (as method argument), retrying to find every 'retry_timeout' seconds.
        Parameters:
        element - ExtendedWebElement to find
        timeout - max time to wait
        Returns:
        is element found on UI

      • isElementWithTextPresent

        public boolean isElementWithTextPresent(ExtendedWebElement element,
                               java.lang.String text)
        Checks page HTML DOM model for element with text presence. It waits for element with text max time = 'explicit_timeout' seconds, retrying to find every 'retry_timeout' seconds.
        Parameters:
        element - ExtendedWebElement to find
        text - expected text that should contain the element
        Returns:
        is element found on UI

        text - expected text that should contain the element
